results.title: Ballade Pour Un Voyou = Ballad for a Scoundrel
results.brief_description:
An ex-convict is recruited to deliver a suitcase whose contents are coveted by a variety of secret agents. When he runs off with the suitcase, the local police grab his girlfriend to ensure the safe delivery of the secret contents. The spies, police and free lance adventure seekers all go after the man and his coveted package. He must decide whether or not to blow up the contents when faced with a showdown with the authorities.

Credits: Producer, Jean Thuillier ; director, Jean-Claude Bonnardot ; writers, Jean-Claude Bonnardot, Jacqueline Sundstrom, Alexandre Tabor ; photography, Jean Badal ; music, Samson Francois.
Cast: Laurent Terzieff, Hildergarde Neff, Philippe Noiret, Michel Vitold, Daniel Emilfork, Etienne Bierry.

results.title: Ballade Pour Un Chien = Ballad for a Dog
results.brief_description:
Remy Viachet is a lonely old man with money worries. During one of his solitary walks, he finds a stray dog and decides to adopt him. Remy manages to sneak the dog in his appartment unbeknown to the concierge. One day the old man is found dead in his flat, the floor littered with dog food tins intended for an animal that does not seem to exist.

Credits: Director, Gerard Vergez ; writers, Maurice Curry, Gerard Vergez ; photography, Patrice Pouget ; music, Francois Rabbath.
Cast: Charles Vanel, Julien Guiomar, Claude Genia, Colette Regis, Alfred Lenglet.

results.title: Ballada o soldate = Ballad of a soldier
results.brief_description:
A naive and unworldly Soviet soldier commits a reluctant act of bravery during World War II. In return he is awarded four days of coveted leave, returning to his mother in order to thatch her roof. En route, the generous teenager uses much of his precious time helping strangers in need. Encountering chaos and destitution, he witnesses the stoicism of the Russian people as they face misery, hunger and displacement. On the train home he meets a woman with whom he falls in love but his fate is sealed — he barely makes it home to his mother, in time to return to the Front and most assuredly his death. A simple and sentimental drama, which documents the Russian wartime experience and winner of several international awards, ‘Ballad of a Soldier’ was the first Russian film to receive acclaim in America during the Cold War period.

Credits: Director, Grigori Chukhrai ; writer, Valentin Yoshov, Grigori Chukrai ; photography, Vladimir Nikolayev, Era Saveleva ; music, Mikhail Ziv ; editing, M. Timofeieva.
Cast: Vladimir Ivashov, Zhanna Prokhorenko, Antonina Maksimova, Nikolai Kryuchkov, Yevgeny Urbansky, Valentina Telegina.

results.title: Ballad to Cornwallis
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Ian McLaren, Rex Tasker and Diane Beaudry
results.brief_description: Balladeer James Bennet satirises the history of Halifax in a song which he composed and sings in honour of the city’s founder. Clad in period costumes, Bennet travels through time against a background of old photographs and paintings, archival and contemporary film footage, until he ultimately finds himself in the midst of the city’s present-day building boom.

results.title: Ballad of Joe Hill
results.brief_description: Joseph Hillstrom, a young Swedish migrant to America in 1902, found prejudice and corruption instead of the equality and opportunity he was expecting. Disturbed by the injustices suffered by workers, Joe Hillstrom became an organizer of the Industrial Workers of the World, the legendary big union with anarchist reputation.

results.title: Ballad of a young man = Wadjah seorang laki-laki
results.creator_credit: Sarinande Films, Turino Djunaidy and Teguh Karya
results.brief_description: Nineteenth century Dutch Batavia serves as a backdrop to influential Indonesian director Teguh Karya’s first feature. ‘Ballad of a Young Man’ is about Amallo, a local of Portuguese descent, and his troubled relationship with his womanising father. His father is an important man in the village who works for the Dutch, keeping watch over their horses. Amallo, on the other hand, is a rebel who steals ammunition and horses from the Dutch soldiers. When Amallo returns to his village after spending some time in the city, he is betrayed by his best friend who is consumed with jealousy. Meanwhile, Amallo’s father has been promoted by the Dutch for recovering stolen horses. The film is told in flashback, a favourite storytelling technique of the director (see also ‘Bitter Coffee’). Slamet Rahardjo - protege of Teguh Karya - now Head of the Film Council and a prominent figure in Indonesia, makes his acting debut as Amallo. Cast also includes W.D. Mochtar and Rima Melati. In Indonesian with English subtitles.

results.title: Ball on vole
results.brief_description: The apparently aimless flight of a ball which goes out of reach and wanders where it will, is presented in a series of amusing incidents and co-incidences as five boys try to capture it. Drama follows its appearance wherever it goes, people are bumped and shot, and it eludes them to the end. A whimsical film with a unique sense of humour.
